definitions.text: a diagram or picture illustrating textual material
examples: the area covered can be seen from Figure 2

definitions.text: alternative names for the body of a human being
examples: Leonardo studied the human body
he has a strong physique
the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

definitions.text: one of the elements that collectively form a system of numeration
examples: 0 and 1 are digits

definitions.text: a model of a bodily form (especially of a person)
examples: he made a figure of Santa Claus
they studied all the great names in the history of France
she is an important figure in modern music

definitions.text: a combination of points and lines and planes that form a visible palpable shape
an amount of money expressed numerically
examples: a figure of $17 was suggested

definitions.text: the impression produced by a person
examples: he cut a fine figure
a heroic figure

definitions.text: the property possessed by a sum or total or indefinite quantity of units or individuals
examples: he had a number of chores to do
the number of parameters is small
the figure was about a thousand

definitions.text: language used in a figurative or nonliteral sense
a unitary percept having structure and coherence that is the object of attention and that stands out against a ground

examples: the coach had a design on the doors

definitions.text: a predetermined set of movements in dancing or skating
examples: she made the best score on compulsory figures

definitions.text: be or play a part of or in
examples: Elections figure prominently in every government program
How do the elections figure in the current pattern of internal politics?

definitions.text: imagine; conceive of; see in one's mind
examples: I can't see him on horseback!
I can see what will happen
I can see a risk in this strategy

definitions.text: make a mathematical calculation or computation

examples: He didn't figure her
